page.title: 20 A Walk Into D-Block
page.content:
On Tuesday, 2nd June 1985, we-the pupils of 1C, Barlby High School, enjoyed a walk into "deepest" D-Block. The weather was sunny as we entered the area at around 10.15a.m. Some pupils took a right turn to look at a ruined farm building. We eventually reached crossroads. Some went to investigate Beaumont's Scrapyard. Two girls carried on down the main road to look at a dis- tant petrol station. The rest of us turned right along a tree-bordered path. We eventually met up with the farm explorers and returned to school.
Credits- This survey has been compiled by Mr C.Allan and all the members of Form 1C, Barlby High School. Thanks also to Mr P.Thorne, Mr D.Johnson, A.Swift (1B), I Craven (1M), B.Hudson and K.Feeney (3G).
